sentences.sContent: Shelley valued her privacy.
sentences.sCn: 谢利很重视自己的隐私。

sentences.sContent: ...This has wiped 6% off the value of the soft tissue paper market in the UK...
...or is here something of particular value about curiosity in and of itself...
...GNP includes loss in value of factories and equipment...
...this totals the value of all goods and services produced and subtracts loss in value of factories and equipment...
...It is calculated by estimating the share of a company's value that cannot be accounted for by its current products and cash flow...
...drew lines through my exclamation marks and argued for the value of restraint in expression...
...They value the environmental quality they preserve...
...True leaders understand the value of action...
...The value of listed shares in American firms collapsed by 57% from its peak in October 2007 to a low in March this year...
...We need to continue to value broad preparation in thinking skills that will serve for a lifetime...
...Questioning the value of a college education seems a bit like questioning the value of happiness...
...The sharing economy is the latest example of the internet's value to consumers...
...It is based on the value of social equality between students and stuff...
...what value is Sun School based on...
...All the advice and public-service announcements about the value of an education that used to sound stale now ring true...
...People my age always seem to overestimate the value of their time and knowledge...
...and hopefully deriving value and pleasure from it...
...kids don't learn the value of anything because they have everything...
...We still believe in rewarding superior achievements and know that these top students truly value the scholarship...
...Colleges taking another look at value of merit-based aid Good grades and high tests scores still matter—a lot—to many colleges as they award financial aid...

synos.tran: [数]值；[经]价值；价格；重要性；确切涵义

phrases.pCn: n. [商]（有别于帐面价值的）市场价值；市价

words.tran: 有价值的；贵重的；可估价的
重要的；宝贵的；贵重的；经估价的
无价值的；不值钱的；微不足道的
评价者；估价者；价格核定人

trans.tranOther: to think that someone or something is important
